title: Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta donates $1 million to Trump inaugural committee amid past tensions
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg donated $1 million to Donald Trump's inaugural committee. This followed a Mar-A-Lago dinner where Zuckerberg showcased Meta's smart glasses and aimed to strengthen ties with the incoming administration. The donation comes despite Trump's past criticisms of Zuckerberg and Facebook, including accusations of election interference and threats of imprisonment.
summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg donated $1 million to Donald Trump's inaugural committee.  This followed a Mar-A-Lago dinner where Zuckerberg showcased Meta's smart glasses and aimed to strengthen ties with the incoming administration.  The donation comes despite Trump's past criticisms of Zuckerberg and Facebook, including accusations of election interference and threats of imprisonment.

title: Taiwan calls China a ‘troublemaker’ as 16 warships, 34 aircraft spotted near island
content: Taiwan detected 16 Chinese warships and 34 aircraft near its waters on Thursday, following large-scale Chinese maritime drills. These drills, involving simulated attacks and blockades, are reportedly China's largest in years and come after Taiwan's President's recent US visit. China claims Taiwan as its territory and opposes its international engagement, particularly with the US.
summary: Taiwan detected 16 Chinese warships and 34 aircraft near its waters on Thursday, following large-scale Chinese maritime drills. These drills, involving simulated attacks and blockades, are reportedly China's largest in years and come after Taiwan's President's recent US visit. China claims Taiwan as its territory and opposes its international engagement, particularly with the US.

title: ‘Justifiable homicide’: Donations flood in for suspected UnitedHealthcare CEO killer Luigi Mangione’s legal defence
content: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has received over $40,000 in donations for his legal defense. The fundraising page and merchandise sales reflect divided public opinion, with some viewing Mangione as a folk hero protesting the US healthcare system, while others condemn the act as a dangerous precedent.
summary: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has received over $40,000 in donations for his legal defense. The fundraising page and merchandise sales reflect divided public opinion, with some viewing Mangione as a folk hero protesting the US healthcare system, while others condemn the act as a dangerous precedent.

New Syrian PM Mohammad al-Bashir 'guarantees rights of all people'
content: Syria's new prime minister, Mohammad al-Bashir, pledged to protect minority rights and urged refugees to return after the ouster of President Bashar al-Assad. Led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), the Islamist-led alliance swiftly defeated Assad's forces, prompting celebrations and mixed reactions. The international community called for stability and a smooth transition as Syria enters a new era.
summary: Syria's new prime minister, Mohammad al-Bashir, pledged to protect minority rights and urged refugees to return after the ouster of President Bashar al-Assad.  Led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), the Islamist-led alliance swiftly defeated Assad's forces, prompting celebrations and mixed reactions.  The international community called for stability and a smooth transition as Syria enters a new era.

title: From party animal to murder suspect: New video of Luigi Mangione reveals his wild college days
Wounds reopen as sectarian clashes flare in Pakistan's border region
content: Once again, Ali Ghulam receives mourners at his home -- his brother and nephew killed 40 years apart in the same sectarian conflict that was reignited this year in northwest Pakistan, claiming 200 lives since July alone. - 'Murdered my dreams' - Ghulam's nephew was killed along with at least 42 others last month, when Sunni gunmen opened fire on a convoy of Shiites being escorted by the police to their homes.
summary: Once again, Ali Ghulam receives mourners at his home -- his brother and nephew killed 40 years apart in the same sectarian conflict that was reignited this year in northwest Pakistan, claiming 200 lives since July alone. - 'Murdered my dreams' - Ghulam's nephew was killed along with at least 42 others last month, when Sunni gunmen opened fire on a convoy of Shiites being escorted by the police to their homes.

title: Drones in New Jersey: What Homeland Security said about mysterious sightings
content: Mysterious drones, some measuring up to 6 feet wide, are being sighted across New Jersey and nearby states, evading tracking efforts. Officials are investigating the nocturnal flights near sensitive areas, while some lawmakers call for military intervention. Though not considered an immediate threat, the drones' origin and purpose remain unknown, prompting calls for stricter regulations.
summary: Mysterious drones, some measuring up to 6 feet wide, are being sighted across New Jersey and nearby states, evading tracking efforts.  Officials are investigating the nocturnal flights near sensitive areas, while some lawmakers call for military intervention.  Though not considered an immediate threat, the drones' origin and purpose remain unknown, prompting calls for stricter regulations.

'Will fight until last minute': South Korean president Yoon defends martial law
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol defended his declaration of martial law, apologized for the deployment of troops, and vowed to fight "until the very last minute." He faces an impeachment motion and a criminal investigation following the dramatic events, which included the arrests of the former defense minister and police chief.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol defended his declaration of martial law, apologized for the deployment of troops, and vowed to fight "until the very last minute."  He faces an impeachment motion and a criminal investigation following the dramatic events, which included the arrests of the former defense minister and police chief.

Searching for loved ones who disappeared, Syrians confront grim reality
content: Following the fall of the Assad regime, families of Syria's disappeared rushed to Sednaya prison, hoping for answers. Hundreds converged on a Damascus morgue after 38 bodies were discovered at the prison, desperately searching for their loved ones among the remains.
summary: Following the fall of the Assad regime, families of Syria's disappeared rushed to Sednaya prison, hoping for answers. Hundreds converged on a Damascus morgue after 38 bodies were discovered at the prison, desperately searching for their loved ones among the remains.

title: In Aleppo, rebels give a sense of what may come in Syria
content: Rebel forces, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), have swiftly established their authority in Aleppo after ousting the Assad regime. They've introduced new uniforms for police, appointed administrators, and reassured residents about security and economic stability. While initial price hikes occurred, some normalcy is returning, with rebels emphasizing justice and protection of property, even offering reassurances to minority communities.
summary: Rebel forces, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), have swiftly established their authority in Aleppo after ousting the Assad regime.  They've introduced new uniforms for police, appointed administrators, and reassured residents about security and economic stability.  While initial price hikes occurred, some normalcy is returning, with rebels emphasizing justice and protection of property, even offering reassurances to minority communities.
